intro: Leiothrix triangularis, commonly known as the triangular leiothrix, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, triangular leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
